website_summaries.verdict: If you’re willing to invest a bit more money on a superior bike headset, the extra-smooth steering and well-built design of the Cane Creek 40-Series should be on your radar.
cons: This bike headrest is on the expensive side
This model was built for mountain bikes and road cycling

customer_reviews.title: Take a picture before disassembling
customer_reviews.text: This is a great headset. I ride a tandem and my headset took a beating. This one is working great as a replacement. However, the documentation that came with it isn't very specific about which way the races and spacers go. I don't work on bicycles for a living and this is the first headset I replaced. I had to do a bit of internet searching before I could find a picture detailed enough to show how everything fit together. Experienced mechanics might laugh at me, but other do-it-yourselfers might have the same problem. A good picture or diagram in the enclosed documentation would have saved me a lot of time.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Cane Creek quality at a modest price.
customer_reviews.text: Headset comes as a stack inside the box, so take photos to remind yourself of the correct stacking order! Everything you'll need except for any spacers you'll want to raise the stem height and give the top cap easy clearance. Good instructions and a one year warranty. The cups seem to be good quality and spin nicely on the cartridge bearings. Recommend having a bike mechanic "chase and face" the head tube and fork crown to make sure the surfaces are flat and parallel before installation, and don't forget to use antiseize when installing the cups and crown race.
customer_reviews.author: Mondoman

customer_reviews.title: My go to for new builds
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 7 or 8 of these headsets over the last few years for various builds. They are sturdy and well-spec'd. I've never had an issue with performance or function both during initial installation or after years of abuse. If you're looking for a tough, quality headset for your hybrid, mountain, or cruiser this is your headset.
customer_reviews.author: Dipstix585

customer_reviews.title: Cane Creek Quality, Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: This headset is at the low cost end of the Cane Creek line, but it provides smooth operation and quality materials. As mentioned elsewhere, care should be taken when installing the crown race bottom plate, as it has a rubber seal that can be easily damaged. If you have a crown race setting tool, this should be no problem. Otherwise, I would suggest either investing in a setting tool or letting your LBS do it for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ron D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: You can’t beat this headset for the price. Replaceable sealed bearings mean a longer service life and longer rides. Cane Creek has been around for decades and there’s a reason why, their products work.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Buttery smooth
customer_reviews.text: Steerer is like butter! Building my first ever frame up mtb, First time I have ever pressed in a headset. Went in with no problem using home made tools. Saved major money!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great budget headset.
customer_reviews.text: These are solid budget headsets, tough enough for anything you throw at it, well constructed, good bearings, durable. Not as pretty as a Chris King but equally functional
customer_reviews.author: Ted Andkilde

customer_reviews.title: Excellent entry headset with Cane Creek quality
customer_reviews.text: Cane creek really do make the best headsets in my opinion. This is an entry model, upgradable and super smooth. Sealed bearings and super lightweight and perfectly milled. Well worth the purchase, especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Pacman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: If your wondering which headset to buy, this is it. Costs a little more but it is worth it. This headset also comes with very detailed instructions.
customer_reviews.author: bolink

customer_reviews.title: great fit and rock solid
customer_reviews.text: i have the park cup presser tool, so install was a snap! this replaced an older Cane with open bearings. awesome upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Jufon

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse Headset
customer_reviews.text: Just a quality headset that will last for many years and meany miles. I’ve put this headset on many a bike and it always looks great and performs.
customer_reviews.author: The Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: The real deal Holyfield.. works better than the cheap junk I bought prior to this set, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jayski

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm.  Already installed it on my bike.  Installed on a 2010 Trek 3500.
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. Already installed it on my bike. Installed on a 2010 Trek 3500.
customer_reviews.author: Carvey P

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headset so far. Smooth and easy to install. Its on my sons DJ'er so hopefully it will last. They price is right as well compared to others. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan F Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: reliable
customer_reviews.text: cane creek is a good brand I've bought 3 of there head sees for different bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Gui Yo

customer_reviews.title: Quality headset
customer_reviews.text: I love these headsets. I now buy these for every bike
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A solid headset.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you race professionally, this will work fine, and probably outlast your bike. The sealed bearings of course make replacement a cinch when they do eventually wear out. I installed mine on a 2013 Surly Troll with a bolt, nut and washers. Went in without a hitch. Crown race took significant full-body force to seat, but that was the powdercoat on the fork's fault. Smooth and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhael

customer_reviews.title: The Beat Head Sets around!
customer_reviews.text: Cane Creek Head Sets are quite possibly the best for the money, or maybe even including the money among all makers! These are easily on par with Chris King, at a fraction of the price! These are fully sealed unlike even the most expensive Ritchey or FSA Headsets!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Ales

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are like $40 something dollars. Have a set of $170 kris king bearings that I run in the same bike sometimes, honestly, can't tell a difference at all besides price
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional
customer_reviews.text: My last headset was exhibiting "indexed steering" which led me to this upgrade for my bike. I never realized what a difference this could make! Hands off control is much easier now, and the bearing seals are amazing. Furthermore, upgrading your headset really seems to have a sort of cache with experienced riders
customer_reviews.author: Metuchen

customer_reviews.title: ... series head set on a 08 diamondback recoil feels awesome rides great couldn't have asked for a better fit
customer_reviews.text: Installed this came creek 40 series head set on a 08 diamondback recoil feels awesome rides great couldn't have asked for a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Relik_

customer_reviews.title: Cane Creek 40-Series Rules!
customer_reviews.text: They are my favorite Headsets! I do many Bike builds & Single speed conversions. Cane Creek 40 always are a perfect fit,light & work smooth as silk! Sent fast too.
customer_reviews.author: re212ssa

customer_reviews.title: Silky smooth steering!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a cheaper Cane Creek headset, which had worn out. This thing is like butter compared to my old one. Steering is silky smooth. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Easy install with a "no name" headset press I got on eBay. Went in straight (with a little fiddling) and looks good and feels smooth & tight. No need to spend over $100 in my opinion if you're not a pro. This hs has amazing quality and looks for a fraction of that.
customer_reviews.author: markm

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy, so far. Haven't had much time on the bike, but the install was slick. The components look to be made well. I like the sealed bearings. Seems a little stiffer than the headset it is replacing. Probably just needs some tweaking.
customer_reviews.author: amazonaton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great option if you don't want to shell out for a Chris King.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to convert from threaded.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my build on my threadless conversion for my 3.0 Cannondale Blacklightening.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, very smooth operation, looks very nice, light weight!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully machined, smooth as silk. This is where the cost and quality curves cross. Other than the colors, I don't know why people would shell out for a Chris King headset. We need more excellent bike parts like this readily available on Prime!
customer_reviews.author: Chris McEliece

customer_reviews.title: looks great on my white frame
customer_reviews.text: Relatively lightweight, kind of stylish, looks great on my white frame. Installed with ease, steering is really smooth. couple of taps and it was in. No wobble or play from the fork after i installed this. Comes with everything, crown race, star nut...etc.
customer_reviews.author: John Burmeister

customer_reviews.title: Nice Headset
customer_reviews.text: It works! Easy installation. I didn't want to overpay for a quality headset and this fit the bill. Engineered with quality construction and materials that should last a long time. Love the smooth feel of the sealed bearings.
customer_reviews.author: BC_Dog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super smooth and easy to install. Less than 2 days shipping! I got it in less than 24 hours!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hillcrest

customer_reviews.title: Cane Creek 40 series 1 1/8” headset
customer_reviews.text: Replacement headset for Cannondale Catalyst. Best headset for the money, sealed bearings and great support from Cane Creek.
customer_reviews.author: gina

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck headset
customer_reviews.text: Good bang for the buck headset. You can spend twice as much and get the same performance. Literally the only gripe to be had with this headset is that it doesn't come in bling bling anodized colors. But if it did no one would but the CC 110. :)
customer_reviews.author: Bigslacker

customer_reviews.title: The product itself is recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth and tight. Performance is noticeable considering i have just upgraded from a stock unsealed bearings headset. Absolutely no play when you squeeze on the brakes. Yet, one thing bothered me. There were visible marks on the cups from some prior removal. I paid for new not used; hence, the one star subtraction. The product itself is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cane creek products install easy, works well
customer_reviews.text: Cane creek products install easy, works well. It's the only headset I'll buy these days. 40 series is high enough quality for every day use. I have tried the 110, but can't justify $100+ price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Best value.
customer_reviews.text: I've used many, MANY headsets in my time, and this is the best headset you'll find for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headset! Smooth like butter
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headset! Smooth like butter! Don't go with the lower model Cane Creek as it has a plastic cap. Spend the extra money and get this one. All aluminum, bearing are smooth! I put this on a custom build I'm doing out of an old GT frame, will update review after I've put some miles on it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Cook Effects

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and smooth, got a great price on it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: great headset
customer_reviews.text: Great headset, perfect upgrade for the 12 year old rusty headset on my Specialized Allez.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, smooth, not much else to say haven't been riding it hard enough to make a call on longevity, no issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Headset!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality piece, looks great and feels smooth and solid. Great upgrade form my 2006 Trek MTB.
customer_reviews.author: ORLANDO C PALMER

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: I recently built a surly pacer frame and saw they use this on their completed bikes. I ordered it and was happy with it. It installed fairly easy and has given me no problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Farrelly

customer_reviews.title: Second Headset
customer_reviews.text: i have this headset on my current bike and i love it..i just have to learn how to adjust the stiffness out..to loose and its shaky and to tight and it won`t turn(stiffness) but overall its a good one!
customer_reviews.author: Terry H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Plan and simple this is a great headset for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Trialsin26

customer_reviews.title: Lightest and, in this builders opinion, the best mini headset.
customer_reviews.text: This is the lightest, and I think it's the best made headset on the market. It is really great quality. Lighter than the Chris King at less than 1/2 the cost. It's a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki

customer_reviews.title: A good upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade the front suspension on my '08 Rockhopper and while I was at it I decided to replace the headset. No issues yet, and the bike handles well.
customer_reviews.author: HitTheTrail

customer_reviews.title: Great price, very reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have this installed on my Surly Moonlander so it's seen lots of dirt, cold temps, snow, sand and more. Still going strong after 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Tad D

customer_reviews.title: nice headset
customer_reviews.text: clean install. works nice and smooth. bought for a second/backup bike so it has very few rides on it but, for the price, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: this is the best "bang for the buck" headset one can install
customer_reviews.text: Without spending 2x as much, this is the best "bang for the buck" headset one can install...
customer_reviews.author: OLAN

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Smooooooth, looks great in polished black. Based on past experience it will last and last.
customer_reviews.author: easyup

customer_reviews.title: Good Price, Great Headset
customer_reviews.text: Installed without too much hassle. Feels and looks great. Much nicer than I expected to find in my price range.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Erlandson

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headset to upgrade the loose ball Aheadset that came stock on my Trek 7500 hybrid. To avoid damage to the crown race and cups, you should have access to a crown race setting tool and cup press. These are available on Amazon as Park Tool CRS-1 and Park Tool HHP-2. With these two tools, installation is straight forward. When I inquired at my Local Bike Shops about the price of installation of a headset, it was an easy decision to purchase the two tools (especially since I had a headset to install on a second bike). Quality and performance of the headset is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headset, installed this on my hard tail mtb
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headset, installed this on my hard tail mtb, technical trails, downhills, roots and rocks, does it all.....
customer_reviews.author: Hardtail62

customer_reviews.title: My Go To Headset
customer_reviews.text: This headset is my go to headset. It's well built and cheap. I've installed it on 2 bikes now with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Ben English

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It just is a great headset for the price. Hands down.
customer_reviews.author: kvalley

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: The headset looks very nice and work very smooth. Im going to buy again for new bike. i highly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Nereo Macatangay

customer_reviews.title: Held up to a lot of weight for touring .
customer_reviews.text: I used this headset the bike I reassembled for touring . The bike was carrying a heavy load for 3,500+ miles without a hitch . I have also noticed this is the same headset used on a couple of bike packing bike from the factory . Looks nice , and preformed well .
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Cooke

customer_reviews.title: It is what I expect, but too old.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 1-1/8 headset. Top head-tube - 33.95mm Stem Clamp - 28.6mm top stack Height - 16mm Bottom Head tube - 33.95mm Crown race - 30.015mm Bottom stack - 12mm Only Complain is that It made in Taiwan, 2010.
customer_reviews.author: Jung G.

customer_reviews.title: Used this headset to put a carbon fork on an older steel frame.  Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Bought an older Bianchi steel frame bike that I wanted to upgrade to a carbon fork. There are limited options for 1" headsets, but I'd had good luck with Cane Creek headsets before, and the price was right, so I decided to go with this headset. I've been quite pleased with this headset! It's performed very well, and looks great too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fritts

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i needed
customer_reviews.text: High quality machining, simple instructions and had no trouble installing. Installed on single speed city bike and the front end has some incredible feel and steers perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Chris Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but you may need a 400 plus ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product,but you may need a 400 plus dollar tool to install it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: make sure you get a crown race for it. It does not come with it.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Turned out I had to get an unsealed bearing which worked out fine. The Cane Creek headset looks like a good ...
customer_reviews.text: Could not use the Cane Creek headset with the Nashbar Carbon front forks with the 1" steerer that I purchased. The bottom diameter on the forks was not 1". The bearing race is 1", top and bottom. Took it to a bike shop were they had to measure it and look for a headset that worked. Turned out I had to get an unsealed bearing which worked out fine. The Cane Creek headset looks like a good product but my review has to be incomplete because I did not use it.
customer_reviews.author: GJM

product_meta.title: Cane Creek 40-Series Traditional Headset
product_meta.description:
Cane Creek's 40-Series headsets have everything you look for in a quality bicycle component -- precision performance, durability, light weight and affordability. And, they're engineered by Cane Creek right here in North Carolina.

 * Durable black oxide steel bearings for long life 
 * 6061-T6 aluminum cups are internally relieved to reduce weight 
 * Cane Creek's innovative Clip-Seal completely seals the top assembly and captures the compression ring to reduce the number of loose parts 
 * High-quality, low friction face-seals on the crown races 
 * Internal parts are cross-compatible across the 10, 40 and 110 series
feature_bullets: Innovative Clip-Seal Seals the Top Assembly and Captures the Compression Ring
Durable Steel Crown Race with Low-Friction Face-Seals
Internal Parts Are Cross-Compatible Across 10, 40 and 110 series
